# Scale: Harmonic in A (Mode: Lydian #2)

## Introduction
The Harmonic scale in A, specifically in the Lydian #2 mode, is a unique and exotic scale that is not commonly used in mainstream music but can be found in jazz, fusion, and world music genres. It has a mystical and dream-like quality to it, thanks to its augmented 2nd interval.

## Notes and Intervals
The notes in the Harmonic scale in A (Lydian #2) are: A, B# (C), C#, D#, E, F#, G#. The characteristic interval that sets this scale apart is the augmented 2nd between the first and second notes (A to B#), as well as the augmented 4th (D#), and augmented 5th (E).

## Musical Flavor
This scale has a mysterious and otherworldly sound due to the combination of the augmented 2nd and augmented 4th intervals. It can be used to create tension and a sense of longing in music. The Lydian #2 mode gives it a slightly altered quality from the standard Lydian scale, making it even more intriguing to work with.

## Songs
Here are 3 songs that use the Harmonic scale in A (Lydian #2) or similar scales:
1. "Spain" by Chick Corea - This jazz fusion masterpiece features sections where the Harmonic scale is used, creating a fusion of traditional jazz with exotic flavors.
2. "Meeting by the River" by Ry Cooder & Vishwa Mohan Bhatt - This collaborative instrumental piece combines elements of blues and Indian classical music, possibly utilizing scales similar to the Harmonic scale in A.
3. "Phrygian Gates" by John Adams - This contemporary classical piano piece explores various scales and modes, including ones with augmented intervals, akin to the Harmonic scale in A.

By incorporating the Harmonic scale in A (Lydian #2) into your musical compositions or improvisations, you can add a unique and captivating element that will intrigue listeners and expand the harmonic palette of your music.
